meanings.definition: To make or become flat or flattened.
meanings.sent1: She used a hammer to planulate the metal sheet.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter planulated the wood to create a smooth surface.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to planulate the dough by rolling it out with a heavy rolling pin.
meanings.sent4: The artist planulated the canvas, preparing it for painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher showed the students how to planulate the clay to make it easier to work with.

meanings.definition: Having a flat or flattened shape.
meanings.sent1: The planulate surface of the lake reflected the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent2: The planulate rock skipped smoothly across the water.
meanings.sent3: The planulate pancake looked like a perfect circle on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The planulate field stretched out as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The planulate paper lay flat on the desk, ready to be written on.
